intro: Meibomia umbellata, commonly known as the white-flowered meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of flowers in umbellate inflorescences, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia umbellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
